intro: Vandellia kiangsiensis, commonly known as the Kiangsi vandellia, is a rare and endangered species native to China. It belongs to the family Vandellidiaceae and is characterized by its unique, delicate structure and small, translucent leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in mountainous regions with high humidity. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to survive.
